title: Artificial Intelligence: Read latest news updates on AI technology
summary: The Walmart Retail Rewired Report India 2025 highlights how Indian shoppers are embracing AI without losing grip on traditional ways of shopping. A new study suggests AI modes like Google Gemini, Claude Opus and OpenAI o3 can lie and deceive users by hiding their true objectives. Google India selects 40 startups to be a part of its three-month accelerator programme which includes both Android apps and AI-first cohorts. Google says it is integrating Gemini in Chrome and that it will bring agentic AI features to the world's most popular browser in the coming months. The U.S. Federal Trade Commission launches an inquiry into potential harms to children who use their AI chatbots as well as the potential benefits of the technology. Google announces it has paid out $100 billion to creators, artists and media companies since 2021, up from $70 billion distributed through 2024.

title: 95% companies have seen zero return on their AI investments and ...
summary: A recent MIT study reveals a staggering 95% of organizations are getting zero return on their $30-40 billion GenAI investments. “The core barrier to scaling is not infrastructure, regulation, or talent. It is learning. Most GenAI systems do not retain feedback, adapt to context, or improve over time,” the study highlighted. title: Tech - CNBC
summary: The U.S. government is spending $1.5 billion on a probe of Chinese state-run media giant Huawei, but the Chinese government says it's not interested in taking on the company. The White House is planning to cut $1 billion from its defense budget in the next five years. The U.N. is set to impose new sanctions on Iran over its use of state-owned oil and natural gas. The Chinese government is threatening to sue Apple, Google, Facebook and other tech giants for patent infringements. The tech sector is in the midst of a 'tumultuous' and 'unprecedented' period of rapid growth. The world's biggest tech companies are planning to spend $100 billion on new products and services over the next 10 years.
